body_html: Maybe if we want ensure zero-probability events are not selected, in a way that is robust to floating point numeric problems, the inBucket check could be forced to false if the difference between prevBucket and curBucket is less than an epsilon. That epsilon might need to depend on the underlying data type (T) being used.
body_text: Maybe if we want ensure zero-probability events are not selected, in a way that is robust to floating point numeric problems, the inBucket  check could be forced to false if the difference between prevBucket and curBucket is less than an epsilon. That epsilon might need to depend on the underlying data type (T) being used.
body: Maybe if we want ensure zero-probability events are not selected, in a way that is robust to floating point numeric problems, the `inBucket ` check could be forced to false if the difference between prevBucket and curBucket is less than an epsilon. That epsilon might need to depend on the underlying data type (T) being used.
